children.subject: it doesn't look bad to apply somewhere, get rejected and apply again next season :)

history.content: I'm looking through Handshake and found that for almost all jobs listed there that matches with me (over 200 companies),  everything that's required is just to attach the resume and submit, which, after finishing polishing the resume, would only take 10 seconds to do. Does this mean I should apply to all those 200 companies, since applications don't take time at all? If I don't get an internship from those companies, will it be a minus if I apply to any of them again next semester? Thanks in advance!
history.subject: Is it good to apply to all jobs you can find?

history.subject: Is there anything negative to applying a lot of jobs?
